image.altText: Five Israeli soldiers walk around a dirt field.

props.synopsis: Israel's military actions in Gaza are acts of self-defence against Hamas and "other terrorist organisations", the legal advisor for Israel's foreign ministry says at the opening of the second day of hearings at the World Court.

title.children: Israel rejects claims of genocide levelled in UN's top court

image.altText: Protesters burning flags.

props.synopsis: Yemen's Houthi rebels vow fierce retaliation for US and British strikes against them, further raising the prospect of a wider conflict in a region already beset by Israel's war in Gaza.

title.children: Houthi rebels vow fierce retaliation after US and British strikes against them

image.altText: A jet aircraft shoots across the flight deck of an aircraft carrier at night.

props.synopsis: There has been a diplomatic dance going on as the West backs Israel and Iran uses its proxies across the region, but now Western superpowers have jets in the sky.

title.children: There has been a proxy war playing out, but now the UK and US have jets in the sky

image.altText: Portrait of a lady in a pink high-vis vest looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's only hemp stalk processing factory is producing "hempcrete" — an uncommon, but highly sustainable building product. The industry says regulation is blocking access to a multi-billion-dollar market.

title.children: 'Hempcrete' is sustainable and eco-friendly, but producers say regulations need to ease up

image.altText: dark clouds gather over nightcliff darwin

props.synopsis: The ongoing rains are making a mockery of spring headlines warning of dangerous bushfires and water shortages, setting a platform for Australia to record a wetter than normal summer.

title.children: Northern Australia, eastern seaboard and Hobart set for another soaking in coming week

image.altText: Blue police tape blocks intersection where emergency service vehicles are parked.

props.synopsis: A car has struck two pedestrians and crashed into a building in Devonport, northern Tasmania, with police warning of a gas leak in the area.

title.children: Car crash causes 'serious damage' to north Tasmanian city's gas network, five hospitalised

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair looks close to tears.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison's press secretary made an angry phone call to a Network Ten news executive after it aired an interview between Brittany Higgins and journalist Lisa Wilkinson, court documents have revealed.

title.children: Court documents detail expletive-ridden call from PM's office to Network Ten over interview with Brittany Higgins

image.altText: A ruin of white timber fence paneling strewn across a lawn.

props.synopsis: A Glengarry family were lucky to be away from home when a truck negotiating a sweeping bend tipped and spilled logs into their yard and home.

title.children: Trail of destruction as Tasmanian log truck tips, spilling logs into home

image.altText: A boy with a hat on, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Northern Territory boy Tristan Frank was last seen near Balgo in outback Western Australia in 2020. He hasn't been seen since.

title.children: Coroner hears scant details of why 14yo boy Tristan Frank has been missing for three years without a trace

image.altText: Black and white grainy photo of women in long white dresses and aprons folding sheets in a large room.

props.synopsis: In the 19th century, Australia was home to Magdalene "retreats", Catholic-run institutions to reform wayward women. For some, the path to penitence was a brutal one.

title.children: Why sex workers and unmarried women worked for no pay at these commercial laundries

image.altText: A composite image shows three black and white portraits of women side by side, wearing jewellery and crowns

props.synopsis: From an alleged poisoning plot to uprooted royals on the run and a secret romance that divided a family, these are just a few accounts of Australia's royal encounters.

title.children: Before the rise of Queen Mary, another Sydney girl spent her life as a wandering queen in exile

image.altText: A  smiling woman holds her little daughter in a snowsuit as her squat on snowy mountains.

props.synopsis: At a time when most toddlers are just getting the hang of walking, 18-month-olf Lucy Brown has staked her claim as the youngest person to reach the Mount Everest base camp.

title.children: Is this Perth toddler the youngest to have ever reached the Mount Everest base camp?

image.altText: Soldiers with an MNDAA flag pose for a photo in front of a bridge.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military reaches a ceasefire agreement with an alliance of ethnic minority guerilla groups it has been battling in the country's north-east.

title.children: Myanmar rebel alliance agrees to ceasefire with ruling military

image.altText: Two purple, concentric circles with a red line passing through it.

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered a surprising "signal" outside of our galaxy after analysing 13 years of data from NASA's Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope.

title.children: NASA astronomers detect high-energy 'signal' outside our galaxy in 'serendipitous discovery'

image.altText: Soldiers with an MNDAA flag pose for a photo in front of a bridge.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military reaches a ceasefire agreement with an alliance of ethnic minority guerilla groups it has been battling in the country's north-east.

title.children: Myanmar rebel alliance agrees to ceasefire with ruling military

image.altText: Woman in winter-wear running on snow with ice-capped mountain in background and clear blue sky

props.synopsis: She'd spent two years preparing – hoping to set a new world record for the longest polar run ever completed – but still, nothing could prepare her for the real thing.

title.children: Melbourne woman who ran 1,300km across Antarctica, says there were 'a lot of tears'

image.altText: Patients being treated at the Royal Melbourne Hospital road trauma unit.

props.synopsis: In one of Australia's busiest trauma hospitals, the phone is ringing, a helicopter is landing and surgery is about to begin.

title.children: Behind the nation's road toll is a growing list of patients now living with life-changing injuries

image.altText: Janet Bowden, Michele Matthews and Lynda Bain, composite image

props.synopsis: Three Tasmanian women speak of their anguish and fear after being told they have to wait months for a mammogram — with the Minister for Women saying she is "really sad" to hear of their plight and the government is working on the problem.

title.children: These three women all found lumps in their breasts. They were told they'd be waiting months for a mammogram

image.altText: A woman looks down on her work documents with a frown

props.synopsis: A difficult environment can be "systemic", says an expert, but with a new law in place to support employee wellbeing, everyone can play a part in change. It first starts with knowing the signs.

title.children: What does a toxic workplace culture look like and how to rise above?

image.altText: Three people hold brooms as they sweep debris off the ground in front of a store.

props.synopsis: The national death toll from violent riots in Papua New Guinea has climbed to 22, with the remains of six people found in Port Moresby today.

title.children: Discovery of six bodies lifts death toll in PNG riots to 22

image.altText: A barista makes a coffee on a machine at a cafe

props.synopsis: The laws around the minimum age Australian kids can work are notoriously rubbery and, as any young worker will tell you, inconsistent or thoughtless laws leave young people vulnerable and open to exploitation, like I was, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: As a naïve teenager I learned the perks and pitfalls of paid work. I lost count of the times I was taken advantage of

image.altText: DPP campaign rally

props.synopsis: Taiwan is voting today to choose its next president. As the election result becomes clear, Canberra will have some delicate decisions to make.

title.children: What Taiwan's election means for Australia

image.altText: A rock carving of legs.

props.synopsis: Despite surveillance cameras put in place after vandalism in late 2023, rock carvings that are thousands of years old at the Bulgandry Aboriginal Art site have been deeply scratched to make them stand out.

title.children: Aboriginal art site vandalised for the second time in 6 months by potentially 'well-intentioned' visitors

image.altText: David Warner walking away from a helicopter that delivered him to the Sydney Cricket Ground for a Sydney Thunder BBL game.

props.synopsis: Less than a week after his Test farewell at the Sydney Cricket Ground, David Warner was touching down on the hallowed turf after a hasty helicopter ride from his brother's wedding.

title.children: David Warner arrives via helicopter for Big Bash game at SCG

image.altText: Man smiling

props.synopsis: The family of a man shot dead by police in New South Wales say they understand the actions taken by officers, but the incident exposes a failure within the systems designed to support people with mental illness.

title.children: Family of man shot by police in Nowra say mental health system failure contributed to his death

image.altText: James Marape and members of his government

props.synopsis: Social and political tensions were rising across Papua New Guinea, then police went on strike and the streets ignited with deadly unrest, but the prime minister is claiming it was "political influence" that lit the match.

title.children: When the PNG PM appeared with 26 colleagues by his side, there was a clear message

image.altText: Soldiers in green camouflage uniforms and holding rifles frisk two men up against a colourful brick wall.

props.synopsis: The brazen gang violence gripping Ecuador has shocked the world, but it's a familiar story in other countries across Latin America, where the shifting tides of the drug war have brought conflict to places previously thought peaceful.

title.children: Surging gang violence across Latin America is now affecting countries previously viewed as safe havens

image.altText: A snake peeking out from bed sheets

props.synopsis: A woman in her 20s is recovering after being bitten in her bed on a rural property in Queensland by what is thought to have been an eastern brown, the world's second most dangerous snake.

title.children: Emergency crew shares image of 'terrifying' snake in woman's bed after it bit her when she was asleep

image.altText: People at Cottesloe Beach on a hot day.

props.synopsis: Cricket fans are being urged to stay sun safe during a severe heatwave which has put horseracing events on hold.

title.children: Severe heatwave set to bake WA as Perth braces for first 40-degree day in almost two years

image.altText: A composite image of Naomi Osaka and Caroline Wozniacki.

props.synopsis: Former Australian Open champions Caroline Wozniacki, Angelique Kerber and Naomi Osaka are all returning to Melbourne Park after having children.

title.children: Working two jobs and maybe missing milestones: Aus Open champs return after having kids

image.altText: A man in a checked shirt and glasses walking outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Police say 35-year-old Phillip Gordan Ronald Salt met two of his alleged victims through a youth engagement role at a church.

title.children: Former church youth worker pleads not guilty to dozens of child sex offences

image.altText: Six people stand in front of a fence with a wide river in the background.

props.synopsis: Making meaningful connections and forming friendships after relocating to a regional area can seem like a daunting task. Here are some tips to make the process less intimidating from people who have done it.

title.children: Advice on how to meet like-minded people and forge friendships after moving to a regional town
